abstract: The $2.375 billion deal may be a harbinger amid speculation that Pfizer will sell or spin off its nonpharmaceutical businesses.
snippet: The $2.375 billion deal may be a harbinger amid speculation that Pfizer will sell or spin off its nonpharmaceutical businesses.
lead_paragraph: Pfizer said on Monday that it had agreed to sell its Capsugel unit, which makes a variety of capsules for drugs, to Kohlberg Kravis Roberts & Company for $2.375 billion in cash.

headline.main: Pfizer Sells Capsule Unit to K.K.R.
